# Quickstart
This guide will help you create your first Reddit Developer Platform app in minutes. For a more detailed walkthrough, see the [**building an app guide**](dev_guide).
## Prerequisites
Before you start, you'll need:
-   [Node.js](https://nodejs.org/) (v22.2.0+)
-   A [test subreddit](https://mods.reddithelp.com/hc/en-us/articles/360001766991-How-to-create-a-subreddit) that you moderate (with less than 200 members)
    -   After creating a test subreddit, visit your Safety Filters under mod tools ([https://www.reddit.com/mod/\[your\_subreddit\_name\]/safety](https://www.reddit.com/mod/%5Byour_subreddit_name%5D/safety)) and turn off the Reputation filter
-   A code editor (we recommend [VS Code](https://code.visualstudio.com/))
**Option 1: Using nvm (Recommended)**
[nvm](https://github.com/nvm-sh/nvm#installing-and-updating) lets you easily manage multiple Node.js versions.

<path>Quickstart, Step-by-step guide</path>
For macOS/Linux:
```bash
# 1. Install nvm
curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/nvm-sh/nvm/v0.39.6/install.sh | bash

# 2. Close and reopen terminal

# 3. Install Node.js
nvm install node
```
For Windows:
-   Install [nvm-windows](https://github.com/coreybutler/nvm-windows)
-   Restart terminal
-   Run `nvm install node`
**Option 2: Direct Installation**
-   Download from [Node.js website](https://nodejs.org)
-   Run the installer
:::caution Direct installation may cause permissions issues. We recommend using nvm instead. :::
**Verify Installation**
```bash
node --version
npm --version
```
## Video tutorial
Watch this video and see how easy it is to create an app. The tutorial starts at 1:35.
## Step-by-step guide
Follow these steps to install Devvit and create your first app.
-   **Install the Devvit CLI** - Choose your preferred package manager:
-   **Log in to Reddit**
```bash
devvit login
```
-   **Create a new project**
```bash
devvit new --template blocks-post
cd my-project
```

<path>Quickstart, Test your app</path>
:::tip Pro tip If you're already a savvy web developer, use `--template web-view-post` (instead of the `blocks-post` template in step 3) to use the [webview component features](webviews.md). :::
-   **Upload your app**
```bash
devvit upload
```
-   **Playtest your app**
```bash
devvit playtest <my-subreddit>
```
:::tip Replace `<my-subreddit>` with your test subreddit name (e.g., `devvit playtest r/MyTestSub`). :::
## Test your app
-   Visit your subreddit
-   In your menu actions, you should see a button that says "Add my post"
-   Refresh your subreddit page, and you should see a counter app
-   As you make code changes, playtest automatically rebuilds and deploys
-   Simply refresh the page to see your latest changes
-   View realtime logs while playtest is active
-   Press `Ctrl + c` to stop playtest
:::tip If you don't see your post, visit your Safety Filters under mod tools ([https://www.reddit.com/mod/\[your\_subreddit\_name\]/safety](https://www.reddit.com/mod/%5Byour_subreddit_name%5D/safety)), turn off the Reputation filter, and try again. :::

<path>Quickstart, Choose your path</path>
## Choose your path
Here are the recommended next steps:
-   Learn about [building interactive posts](./interactive_posts.md)
-   Check out the [showcase](/docs/showcase/apps.mdx) to see example apps
-   Learn how to [publish](./publishing.md) your app
:::note Reddit collects usage metrics when you use the Devvit CLI. See [Reddit's Developer Terms](https://www.redditinc.com/policies/developer-terms) and [Privacy Policy](https://www.reddit.com/policies/privacy-policy). Opt out with `devvit metrics off`. :::
